(Older Blog Posts)

My old weblog lives at billymeinke.wordpress.com. What you'll find there is a timeline of posts telling my experience exploring computer and web technology in the context of learning and education. Earlier posts were largely reviews and tutorials of technology tools, then moving into involvement with Mozilla's Open Badges microcredentialling project, with later posts reflecting on Open Education and Open Science+Data.

Go to the old blog

Other Written Works

I've blogged for Creative Commons (CC), the Public Library of Science (PLOS), and the OER Research Hub. Here are links to select works on my own blog and others:

Debrief: Sprinting to Build an Open Science Course CC blog | February 2013
Open Data Day, Course Sprints, and Hackathons! PLOS SciEd blog | February 2013
OER Fellowship: Lenses on the Landscape of Open Education OER Hub blog | March 2014
MapWorks Learning combines OER and open data to protect biodiversity CC blog | August 2014
